snippet: A classified replica of Iran’s nuclear facilities in Tennessee is but one part of an extensive crash program within nine U.S. atomic laboratories to block Tehran’s nuclear progress.
abstract: Nation's nine atomic laboratories are undertaking ambitious and extensive crash program to stop Iran's progress with its nuclear program; secretive project is technological obsession for thousands of lab workers who are working around clock to answer questions from nuclear negotiators.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and WILLIAM J. BROAD
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and William J. Broad from New York.

lead_paragraph: A classified replica of Iran’s nuclear facilities in Tennessee is but one part of an extensive crash program within nine U.S. atomic laboratories to block Tehran’s nuclear progress.

headline.main: Atomic Labs Across the U.S. Race to Stop Iran
headline.print_headline: In U.S. Labs, a Race to Stop Iran
